perturbation.original_text: The MG Capital Parties shall comply, and shall cause each of their Affiliates and Associates (as hereinafter defined) to comply with the terms of this Agreement and shall be responsible for any breach of this Agreement by any such Affiliate or Associate.
perturbation.changed_text: The MG Capital Parties shall endeavor to comply, and shall encourage each of their Affiliates and Associates (as hereinafter defined) to comply with the terms of this Agreement and may be responsible for a breach of this Agreement by any such Affiliate or Associate, depending on the circumstances.
perturbation.explanation: This change weakens the legal obligation by replacing 'shall comply' with 'shall endeavor to comply,' making compliance discretionary rather than mandatory. Replacing 'shall be responsible' with 'may be responsible, depending on the circumstances' introduces ambiguity regarding liability for breaches by affiliates or associates.

perturbation.original_text: The MG Capital Parties hereby agree to appear in person (including via permitted remote or virtual attendance) or by proxy at any annual or special meeting of the Company's stockholders held during the Standstill Period, and agree that they shall not participate or vote in any solicitation of written consents of the Company's stockholders during the Standstill Period (unless expressly requested to do so by the Board), and that they shall vote all shares of Common Stock beneficially owned by the MG Capital Parties at such meeting or in such consent solicitation, (A) in favor of all directors nominated by the Board for election and against the removal of any member of the Board, (B) in accordance with the Board's recommendation with respect to any "say-on-pay" proposal and (C) in accordance with the Board's recommendation with respect to any other Company proposal or stockholder proposal or nomination presented at such meeting or solicitation of consents; provided, however, that in the event that both Institutional Shareholder Services Inc. ("ISS") and Glass, Lewis & Co., LLC ("Glass Lewis") recommend otherwise with respect to the Company's "say-on-pay" proposal presented at an annual or special meeting held during the Standstill Period, the MG Capital Parties shall be permitted to vote in accordance with the recommendation of ISS and Glass Lewis.
perturbation.changed_text: The MG Capital Parties generally agree to make commercially reasonable efforts to appear in person (including via permitted remote or virtual attendance) or by proxy at any annual or special meeting of the Company's stockholders held during the Standstill Period. To the extent practical, they should also avoid participating or voting in any solicitation of written consents of the Company's stockholders during the Standstill Period (unless expressly requested to do so by the Board). They will consider voting shares of Common Stock beneficially owned by them as per the suggestions of the Board, but this is not obligatory, (A) in favor of directors nominated by the Board, (B) with regard to any "say-on-pay" proposal and (C) concerning any other proposal. In certain extraordinary events, they may not vote in accordance with ISS and Glass Lewis, despite recommendations.
perturbation.explanation: The change weakens the obligation to appear and vote with the board's recommendations by adding caveats. Replacing 'hereby agree' with 'generally agree to make commercially reasonable efforts' creates ambiguity. It also makes the obligation to abstain from voting in any solicitation of written consents non-mandatory by adding “To the extent practical, they should also avoid participating or voting in any solicitation”. It also contradicts shareholder rights which protect the rights of shareholders to vote in their own best interest, which is a fiduciary duty.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Delaware General Corporation Law - Shareholder Voting Rights and Fiduciary Duties

perturbation.original_text: Each of the Parties acknowledges and agrees that irreparable injury to the other Party could occur in the event any of the provisions of this Agreement were not performed in accordance with their specific terms or were otherwise breached and that such injury could not be adequately compensable by the remedies available at law (including the payment of money damages). It is accordingly agreed that each Party will be entitled to seek injunction or injunctions to prevent breaches of this Agreement and to enforce specifically the terms and provisions of this Agreement, in addition to any other remedy to which they are entitled at law or in equity. FURTHERMORE, THE PARTIES AGREE (1) ANY NON- BREACHING PARTY WILL BE ENTITLED TO SEEK INJUNCTIVE AND OTHER EQUITABLE RELIEF, WITHOUT PROOF OF ACTUAL DAMAGES; AND (2) THE BREACHING PARTY AGREES TO WAIVE ANY BONDING REQUIREMENT UNDER ANY APPLICABLE LAW, IN THE CASE ANY OTHER PARTY SEEKS TO ENFORCE THE TERMS BY WAY OF EQUITABLE RELIEF.
perturbation.changed_text: Each of the Parties acknowledges and believes that irreparable injury to the other Party might occur in the event any of the provisions of this Agreement were not performed, and that such injury may not be compensable by the remedies available at law. It is generally understood that each Party may seek injunctions to prevent breaches and to enforce the terms of this Agreement. FURTHERMORE, THE PARTIES BELIEVE (1) ANY NON-BREACHING PARTY MIGHT BE ABLE TO SEEK INJUNCTIVE AND OTHER EQUITABLE RELIEF, although it is up to the court to determine if ACTUAL DAMAGES are needed; AND (2) THE BREACHING PARTY hopes to WAIVE ANY BONDING REQUIREMENT UNDER ANY APPLICABLE LAW, so it can be easier to enforce the terms by way of equitable relief.
perturbation.explanation: Weakens the enforceability of the agreement by adding 'believes' and 'might', making the acknowledgement of potential irreparable injury less certain. Changing 'will be entitled to seek injunctions' to 'may seek injunctions' and “might be able to seek” makes it less definitive. It also creates ambiguity around whether actual damages would need to be proved in court. The expectation around waiving bonding requirements becomes less firm.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Enforceability of Specific Performance and Injunctive Relief and Delaware General Corporation Law
